introduction: Excerpt from Moby-Dick by Herman Melville
text: "Captain Ahab’s relentless pursuit of the white whale, Moby Dick, consumes him, driving him to the brink of madness. His obsession blinds him to the dangers he faces, as he risks the lives of his crew to achieve his revenge."
question: Which line from Moby-Dick best illustrates Ahab’s obsession?
A: “There she blows! A hundred leagues ahead, there lies my fate.”
B: “I leave a white and turbid wake; pale waters, paler cheeks, where’er I sail.”
C: “The ship’s course is mine to command, yet the sea cares not for my will.”
D: “I’ll chase him round Good Hope, and round the Horn, and round the Norway Maelstrom, and round perdition’s flames before I give him up.”
explanation:
Choice B is correct as it directly captures Ahab’s obsessive determination to pursue Moby Dick at any cost, highlighting his relentless commitment.
Choice A is incorrect as it reflects Ahab’s journey but not his obsession.
Choice C is misleading, showing control but lacking obsessive intent.
Choice D is incorrect, as it hints at destiny but not the depth of his fixation.
